F4839636B91B4F85B339B1BF73EFA3DA.description:
Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required
competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and chapter
competitions.

FD7250D1BF8D4933BD693FAA3A83FFEC.description:
Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can promote
lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

04336206CF8B47C3BA63E1F69B5D8779.description:
Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through participation in
related student organizations (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) including but not limited to conferences,
competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other student organization activities

55668C62365E46B392592686C9B82812.description:
Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) can
develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship through
innovative leadership and career development programs.

9B6B8D8DC2EB45CFBF27B4B083B26FFA.description:
Explain the goals, mission, and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA)
and/or Technology Student Association (TSA) and/or SkillsUSA.

A5836263E6B64A0B8D2C7B99AC865512.description:
Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology
education courses through leadership development, school and community service projects,
entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

components.

precedents from industry affect how IT operates. Differentiate between national, state, local,

and legal issues in business.

Common internet crimes, techniques to identify criminal activity and prevention actions
related to cybercrime

and security breaches.

61FD00D9C9B24A6E8730756D6D521612.description: Virus, open or free networks, user control methods, file sharing, etc

01D3256D899B4A26B78B92EC51AF8B17.description:
Plagiarism, piracy, illegal downloading, copy-right infringement, licensing infringement,
inappropriate use of software, hardware, and mobile devices

Describe personal and legal consequences of inappropriate use of resources and online
content

3A1D264CCEE740E79D20521BBD7CC47C.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of technology-related problems such as Internet addiction,
mobile phone addiction, and always-connected devices.

34124C979531407D94277BB1862508BC.description:
Understand human, cultural, and societal issues related to technology and practice legal and
ethical behavior.

5FFF11AC19C34AA99E95AF6F7D56D0D4.description: Promote and model digital etiquette and responsible social technology interactions, permanence of digital footprints, online image and presence, etc.

a. Promote and model digital etiquette and responsible social technology interactions,
permanence of digital footprints, online image and presence, etc.

Recognize the ethical and legal issues while accessing, creating, and using digital tools and

F2C9CB8C45C14DE0A16CD25227F42186.description:
Demonstrate positive cyber citizenry by applying industry accepted ethical practices and
behaviors.

F8D0F3BF3F47417DB9578AD8E976B6A0.description:
Describe, analyze, develop, and follow policies for managing ethical and legal issues in the
business world and in a technology-based society.

CA323395A8D24892BED2F3D3D2CB6666.description:
Demonstrate an understanding of Computational Problem Solving as a part of Computational

Define and demonstrate understanding of Knowledge-Based articles (KB) and the impact of

Define and demonstrate folder and file management and the importance of data back-up

Recognize online risks and dangers in order to take appropriate actions to protect the
business and self while using digital tools and resources.

93EBAC6C396A44BB8D72430887BA0F8B.description:
Describe trends in emerging, evolving, and future computer technologies and their influence

FA19D9A7897444079655EB327C4BFA6A.description:
Demonstrate understanding of how to set up a basic computer workstation, including various
computer types, internal components, connectors, monitors, keyboards, mice, printers,
computer voltage, and power requirements.

Identify hardware device functions, including peripheral devices, input devices, and portable

8470304324D144F1AEDE4DA3BE40ADF9.description: Identify, evaluate, select, and use appropriate technology.

6E7C594A5CCC48D0866D50088F5C1ED9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, and database
software as a communication tool for business.

F884D758176043C69B5E5A2FA56D70B3.description: Ensure that your assistance promotes the best interests of the company.

B4E492F49F27429AAE514D02A9149481.description:
Interact with customers and colleagues in a professional manner (e.g., prompt, friendly,
courteous, respectful, helpful, knowledgeable, and understandable).

D42C050436AF4C47B6B5BA0237504ED8.description:
Project a professional business image (e.g., appearance, voice, grammar, word usage,
enunciation, nonverbal communication).

90A83B6B9B664472AC7FDD7D0FC572F8.description: Determine the individual needs of the audience.

CCD89240814845DBA7E8F0C526D41720.description: Demonstrate ability to assist all audiences in a professional manner.

6C1B41562323400C808D339B679F14AF.description: Demonstrate an ability to provide “value-add” partnership between IT and business.

D6AC25551B434F6CBBAC30EB573D2F5E.description:
Communicate how technology can be used to create solutions to business challenges
and present to stakeholders in professional business format.

43E0A9CCE952488B8A85E8A5298E6A97.description:
Explain the impact of Information Technology (IT) to a business and how it affects the
bottom line.

25C6165B277E4CB5BE9A63C0246CA4BA.description: Recognize the importance of each audience to a business

58B307373C9248CFBF8B330104E88FF7.description:
Differentiate between the different audiences of a business, including users, clients,
customers, contractors, vendors, and others.

53E30AB878824E4C871C74CB2A3BAEE7.description:
Demonstrate effective professional communication skills (oral, written, and digital) and
practices that enable positive relationships with all audiences of a business.

E12027D093904DE381617275B3224307.description: Explore careers in IT focused on customer relationships.

5677A04018344B8187D9C79D6E60F126.description:
Research specific IT careers, including post-secondary continuing education options, IT
credentials, required job skills, potential salaries in Georgia, and work environment. Upload to
online career portfolio.

4E4E69CF13AC41BCB8AA7B8FBC4AD71C.description:
Explore the impact of emerging technologies on careers, including non-traditional technology
fields and careers in each of the Georgia Career Clusters.

013D928666404FC996CFB9BAA637BE9A.description:
Use collaborative tools to communicate with team members, such as online meeting platforms,
group messaging, and shared online documents and files.

D07E3BB60AC9408CBF11E85CBBA40A81.description: Work in a team to solve problems and share knowledge.

08332EB485254C5ABF7F9538818B11E5.description: Develop technical reading and writing skills to follow instructions.

B3DB8CC1675A43E8A700AFD679B325FC.description:
Explore, research, and present findings on positions and career paths in technology and the
impact of technology on chosen career area.

EE8851B79E9842B296F6FE859D13C82E.description:
Organize the portfolio in a manner that makes documents and artifacts easy to locate and
access for review.

551C6C86C87746EB87D6D59AD4544743.description:
Identify and upload industry-appropriate artifacts reflective of mastered skills throughout this
course. Write and include a reflective entry for each artifact discussing steps taken, problems
encountered and how they were overcome, and other pertinent information about the learning.

B020D80190A645A7B1684C36459F38D4.description:
Upload additional standard job search items, such as digital badges and certificates earned for
industry-recognized credentials.

5667C2A51EA34B4AAAA96CB8519CB32A.description:
Upload a professional, true, and accurate résumé and cover letter seeking employment for a
position representative of current skills and knowledge.

EEE3A18C4787491598752785A148D8B0.description:
Establish an account for long-term use to upload professional artifacts over the course of the
career pathway.

7A5FB0CF6E8145C6BED1706ECCCE13D6.description:
Compare a variety of secure online repositories and select the best one for specific career
goals, such as Github for education, Dropbox, Jimdo, Uxfol.io, Portfoliobox and many others.

6742CAFD796148ECAB6464418AF13178.description: Establish a personal online career portfolio and begin uploading relevant artifacts.

29FE7BFEB9C946A099E51778AAFCE1BA.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior and language.

90A8E2436DEC4489823436DDAA16C88F.description:
Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to
be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills.

BDE23C506BB54F7786D5D5E0C557C606.description:
Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty,
accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

71B96CAF784F4FBB961346168683D308.description:
Exhibit critical thinking and problem-solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in
career planning and employment situations.

508DBE45D78F44EC9052F3FB709F5C48.description:
Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and
methods.

0BC41D450582493CB895F10936B7EBFE.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

89D8A04DB43544BE8917B9DDB78E42A2.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
